titleStmt.title: Barnes, White & Co. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1160

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
A. M. BARNES,
W. H. SMITH,
J. W. WHITE.
EXCHANGE BANK, BARNES, WHITE & CO.
Mt. Sterling, Ky., Decr 25 1863
His Excellency
Thomas. E Bramlett
Governer Frankfort Ky
Dr Sir

On Yesterday we received a letter Brig Genl J T Boyle directing us to place to your credit a Package of Money deposited with us by Capt John L Williams late Provost Marshall at this place. We find on opening the Package that it Contained One Hundred & ninety three Dollars in good money & Sixteen dollars in Broken Bank & Conterfeit Paper
This Money was taken from the late James Keller after his death & we are informed by Officers of this post that there was near four Hundred Dollars deliverd over to Capt Williams
We inclose You our Certificate #160 for One Hundred & Ninety three Dolls.
Recv of Tho E Bramlette transfer & delivery of above certificate of deposit for $193 Decr 31st 1863,

Wm ^his X mark^ Watkins
attest, Wm L Bramlitte
